page.title: 17WOKINGHAM - LOCAL COUNCILS
page.content: {Wokingham Town Council}is the first tier in the local government chain housing its offices at the town hall in the market place. There are eight wards served by the town council with 24 elected town councillors. The council has committees for finance and general purposes, amenities and planning. In l822 the town council was granted a {charter by Queen Victoria }making it a borough with an elected mayor. The district council has existed since local government reorganisation in l974. It is the middle tier of government covering almost 70 square miles in the centre of Berkshire. There are over l24,000 people and this is expected to increase. Berkshire county council is the top tier of local government.
